abstract: Eight patients (nine tumors) with histologically proven renal oncocytoma are presented

titre: [The effect of fatty compounds with different ratios of the polyunsaturated fatty acids of the omega-3 and omega-6 families on the expression of food-related anaphylaxis, on the liver cytochrome P-450 system and on 17-hydroxycorticosteroid metabolism in guinea pigs]
abstract: The effect of fat composition with a different ratio of polyunsaturated fatty acids of families omega 3 and omega 6 on expression of experimental dietary anaphylaxis, liver monooxygenase system and metabolism of 17-oxycorticosteroides (17-OCS) in guinea-pig have been investigated

titre: Nitric oxide as a retrograde messenger in the nucleus tractus solitarii of rats during hypoxia
Effects of methylprednisolone and 21-aminosteroids on mitogen-induced interleukin-6 and tumor necrosis factor-alpha production in human peripheral blood mononuclear cells
abstract: The compounds U-74389G (16-desmethyl tirilazad) and U-74500A are two of the novel series of nonglucocorticoid 21-aminosteroids (or lazaroids) which mimic the high-dose neuroprotective pharmacology of the glucocorticoid methylprednisolone (MP) in the injured CNS

titre: Supra-additive natriuretic synergism between bendroflumethiazide and furosemide in rats
abstract: To examine the diuretic and natriuretic synergism between bendroflumethiazide (BFTZ) and furosemide (FUR), the acute diuretic and natriuretic response to BFTZ was compared when given alone, during acute and during chronic FUR infusion

titre: Continuing medical education in Maritime Canada: the methods physicians use, would prefer and find most effective
abstract: A study of the continuing medical education of practising physicians in Nova Scotia, New Brunswick and Prince Edward Island was conducted in 1979-80 by means of a mailed questionnaire

titre: Evaluating bilharzial ureteropathy for surgery
abstract: In a study of 115 ureters showing chronic bilharzial changes, 4 main patterns of ureteropathy are defined

titre: ECT: I
abstract: Patients' experiences and attitudes

titre: [The antimutagenic activity of ternary diallyl copolymers]
abstract: Antimutagenic activity of triple copolymers of diallyl origin was investigated by animal cell test (mouse bone marrow erythrocytes, 1.5 Gy of gamma irradiation) and by plant cell test (seeds of barley, 5 Gy of gamma irradiation)

titre: A SP1 binding site in the GC-rich region is essential for a core promoter activity of the human endothelial nitric oxide synthase gene
abstract: Endothelial nitric oxide synthase (eNOS) is an important oxygenase which catalyzes the conversion of L-arginine to L-citrulline to form nitric oxide (NO), a potent important factor for vasodilation and inhibition of platelet aggregation

titre: Mechanisms of drug eruptions: Part I
abstract: The pathogenetic mechanisms underlying common, and less common but severe, adverse cutaneous drug reactions are reviewed

titre: Scalp replantation after traumatic injury
abstract: A 30-year-old female patient lost her scalp in an industrial accident

titre: [False aneurysm of the brachiocephalic artery following subclavian vein catheterization]
abstract: The difficult insertion of a right subclavian catheter in a 63-year-old patient resulted in a pseudoaneurysm of the brachiocephalic artery requiring a resection-suture

titre: Giant cell carcinoma of the lung
abstract: A 50-year-old non-smoking, hypertensive female, presenting with superior vena caval compression, was found to have giant cell carcinoma of the lung

titre: Migration of the acetabular socket after total hip replacement determined by roentgen stereophotogrammetry
abstract: In order to evaluate the feasibility of a roentgen stereophotogrammetric method for the analysis of the migration pattern of joint prostheses, tantalum balls were implanted into the acetabular socket and the pelvic bone during total hip replacement in four patients with rheumatoid arthritis
